titleStmt.title: The courtiers academie comprehending seuen seuerall dayes discourses: wherein be discussed, seuen noble and important arguments, worthy by all gentlemen to be perused. 1 Of beautie. 2 Of humane loue. 3 Of honour. 4 Of combate and single fight. 5 Of nobilitie. 6 Of riches. 7 Of precedence of letters or armes originally written in Italian by Count Haniball Romei, a gentleman of Ferrara, and translated into English by I.K.
Discorsi. English
titleStmt.author: Romei, Annibale, conte, 16th cent.
Keper, John, b. 1546 or 7, attributed name.
I. K.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
